It appears the mere presence of the folder ~/.ant/lib causes a NullPointerException...

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.ContributedClasspathEntriesEntry.getRuntimeClasspath
Entries(ContributedClasspathEntriesEntry.java:87)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.DefaultEntryResolver.resolveRuntimeClasspathEntry

I've been able to easily duplicate this bug on a separate OS X box by creating that directory and running 
any ant task.  I have NOT been able to duplicate this on Windows, but I'm not too sure what directories 
ant looks for on Windows.  A temporary workaround is to open the ant runtime preferences and set the 
Ant Home manually.
Kevin could you confirm the problem on the latest code?
can't look right now, but will get to it ASAP. Moving to my inbox so I don't forget.
This happens for me as well. AntCorePreferences.getAdditionalClasspathEntries() is returning null.

Created an attachment (id=32530)
patch

in restoreAdditionalEntries the userLibs were never added to additionalEntries if the toolsJarEntry is null. Apple VMs don't have a tools.jar, everything is included in classes.jar instead (on boot classpath).
released patch to HEAD. DarinS please verify.
*** Bug 127816 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
